title: Are humans better at creation or destruction? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ll venture a few thoughts here.  It is much easier to destroy than to create. There are so many examples, but I’ll take one. The World trade Centre in New York was destroyed in a few hours on 9/11/2001. The Freedom tower was finished in 2015. Although it took only 11 years[1] , the full enterprise took closer to 14 years, which in itself is very fast. So, whatever example you take destroying is always easier.  Creation takes a lot of effort. It usually takes persuading a lot of people, and it takes a lot of time and effort. Wether it is building a plane, a ship, a road, a factory, a company, it takes a lot of time and effort. And It is a never ending process. We are perpetually building on prior steps. After 2 story buildings, came 3, 4, 5-story buildings. After fixed lined phones came wireless phones … So, us, humans, we are perpetually building and creating, and overcoming new challenges.  Now, us, humans, we have also been able to conceive of extremely powerful weapons of mass destruction, like nuclear bombs, and of multiple sophisticated genocides executed with mathematical precision. So yes, we are also very good at destruction.  However, the most compelling argument, in my mind, would be: look around. What do you see? Do you see things that are built, things that are harmonious and clean, things that work smoothly? Or do you see rubble and destruction?  Therefore, overall, I think, in our universal consciousness, we are better at creating things. all the best! Are people better at creating things or destroying them? Footnotes[1] Official 11 Year Time-Lapse Movie of One World Trade Center

Creation is an on going process. Destruction incidentally, is one of the consequences in the process. The word “Jagat” - The World - takes root from the “Constantly changing” What’s created now, is bound to get changed, if not destroyed, in the future. It is thus a chain reaction of evolution for millenniums. A change for the better, in most of the cases, is a process of Creation. A change for the worse, is an eventual stumbling block in the path of creation. Humanity has come this far thru a tumult of Creative & destructive minds. Creation and Destruction, exists in the human minds – One or the other, is an expression of the inner inspiration, urge or agitation. Worlds have come into existence in the vast expanse of the Cosmos. And so have many worlds gone into extinction….. But Creation is Supreme. It is the finest state of Consciousness – To beautifully express itself over a period of time immemorial !

Destruction is always going to be easier than creation because of entropy. A neolithic man would struggle to build a computer, but he would find it easy enough to break one. Similarly, I bet I could break whatever inconceivably advanced technology they come up with in the future. In fact, I bet I will - probably on the day I buy it. Hell, this phone I'm using right now is completely smashed. So I think destruction comes more easily, but not because we are more destructive. It's just because it's always easier to fuck things up; you have so many more options. In fact, it's pretty impressive that we manage to successfully create anything at all, given that the most basic laws of the universe seem so keen to see us fail.

Humankind’s creations have taken up huge chunks of the world, but in doing so destroyed everything that was there before, so it basically adds up to zero. It is physically more easy to destroy than to create, so any uncoordinated activity tends to favour destruction. However, the entropy of a human town seems at least on a superficial level to be lower than in a forest, where things are more disorderly and less organised. So maybe we are better at creation.
